benchmark_details.name: VISCO (Visual Self-Critique and Correction)
benchmark_details.overview: VISCO is the first benchmark that evaluates the fine-grained critique and correction capabilities of large vision-language models (LVLMs), focusing on their ability to self-improve through critique.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To analyze and improve the self-improvement capabilities of LVLMs through critique and correction.

data.source: Curated from 18 datasets across 8 tasks involving reasoning and perception.
data.annotation: Dense annotations performed by expert human annotators.

methodology.calculation: VISCore is calculated as the geometric mean of F1 scores for answer, step, and explanation critiques.
methodology.interpretation: Higher VISCore indicates better performance in critique and correction capabilities.
methodology.validation: Models evaluated on a variety of tasks with metric correlation against human evaluations.
